title_en: Shipping: a warning strike by dockers in Emden
summary_en:
The workers of the seaport in Emden have announced a warning strike by the Verdi trade union.
The strike affected the first shift of EVAG Emder Traffic- and Automotive GmbH.
The break started at 6:00 and will last until 14:00.
About 50 union members took part in a warning strike.
This is the fourth such action in the current round of tariffs after warning strikes in Hamburg, Bremen and Bremerhaven.
The second round of negotiations will take place on June 6.
The union demands an increase in hourly wages by three euros from June 1 and a corresponding increase in shift allowances.
The promotion period should be twelve months.
Ulbrich is calling for increased incomes, especially for low-wage groups, due to inflation in recent years.

title: –ü—Ä–æ–¥–∞–≤—â–∏—Ü—ã Inditex –≤ –õ–∞-–ö–æ—Ä—É–Ω—å–µ –∑–∞–ø–∏—Ä–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –≤ —à—Ç–∞–±-–∫–≤–∞—Ä—Ç–∏—Ä–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –ø–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å –æ–±—Å—É–¥–∏—Ç—å –∏—Ö —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è
title_en: Inditex saleswomen in La Coruna lock themselves in the company's headquarters to ask to discuss their terms
summary_en:
A group of Inditex store clerks in La Coruna demands fulfillment of obligations and resumption of negotiations.
Female delegates represent more than 70% of the company's dependents in the province of La Coruna.
They want to discuss their working conditions at the company's headquarters, as colleagues from other countries do.
CIG criticizes Inditex's policy of removing and centralizing labor relations in Madrid.
The company claims that CIG is already represented at the negotiating table in Madrid.
Delegates are demanding agreement on items related only to the province, such as plus thirst, plus seniority and a food voucher.
They consider it unfair and discriminatory that working women from the same province have different working conditions.
